alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 3:13PM MST until August 12 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR FAR NORTHWEST COCONINO COUNTY... At 309 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that only light rain continues across the warned area, over the Mohawk and Prospect Creek drainages between Fraziers Well and the Colorado River in the Grand Canyon. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain fell earlier this afternoon. Flash flooding is likely ongoing, with floodwaters along Mohawk Canyon reaching the Colorado River. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hualapai Reservation and Grand Canyon National Park. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Prospect Valley, Albers Wash and Mohawk Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
